[[West Point, Mississippi|West Point]], [[Mississippi]], [[United States]] | death_date = | instrument = [[Human voice|Vocals]] | genre = [[Blues]] | occupation = [[Musician]], [[singing|singer]] | years_active = Late 1960s-present | label = [[Delmark Records|Delmark]]
Deluge
Airway | associated_acts = | website = [http://www.ZoraYoungMusic.com www.ZoraYoungMusic.com] }} '''Zora Young''' (born January 21, 1948, [[West Point, Mississippi|West Point]], [[Mississippi]], [[United States]]){{Cite web|first= |last= |url={{Allmusic|class=artist|id=p42517/biography|pure_url=yes}}|title=Biography by Linda Seider |publisher=Allmusic.com |accessdate=November 20, 2009}} is an [[United States|American]] [[blues]] [[singing|singer]]. She is a distant [[Kinship|relative]] of [[Howlin' Wolf]].{{Cite book | first= Tony | last= Russell | year= 1997 | title= The Blues - From [[Robert Johnson (musician)|Robert Johnson]] to [[Robert Cray]] | edition= | publisher=Carlton Books Limited | location= Dubai | page= 195 | isbn= 1-85868-255-X}} Young's family moved to [[Chicago]] at age seven and sang [[gospel music|gospel]] at the Greater Harvest Baptist Church. As an adult she began singing blues and [[Rhythm and blues|R&B]] music, and over the course of her career played with [[Junior Wells]], [[Jimmy Dawkins]], [[Bobby Rush]], [[Buddy Guy]], [[Albert King]], [[Professor Eddie Lusk]], and [[B. B. King]]. Among those she has collaborated with on [[gramophone record|record]] are [[Willie Dixon]], [[Sunnyland Slim]], [[Mississippi Heat]], [[Paul DeLay]], and [[Maurice John Vaughan]]. In 1982, she toured Europe on the bill with [[Bonnie Lee]] and [[Big Time Sarah]] in 'Blues with the Girls', and then [[sound recording and reproduction|recorded]] an [[album]] in [[Paris]], [[France]]. She was later cast in the role of [[Bessie Smith]] in the stage show, ''The Heart of the Blues''. By 1991 she had recorded the album, ''Travelin' Light'', with the Canadian guitar player, [[Colin Linden]]. Young has [[concert tour|toured]] [[Europe]] more than thirty times, in addition to appearances in [[Turkey]] and [[Taiwan]]. She was the featured performer at the [[Chicago Blues Festival]] six times. In 2014, she was nominated for a Blues Music Award in the 'Koko Taylor Award (Traditional Blues Female)' category.{{cite web|url=http://blues.about.com/od/bluesawards/a/2014-Blues-Music-Awards.htm |title=2014 Blues Music Awards Nominees and Winners |publisher=Blues.about.com |date= |accessdate=2014-05-16}} ==Discography== *''Travelin' Light'' ([[Deluge Records]], 1991) *''Learned My Lesson'' ([[Delmark Records]], 2000) *''Tore Up from the Floor Up'' (Delmark, 2005) *''Sunnyland'' (Airway, 2009) *''The French Connection'' (Delmark, 2009) ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Authority control|VIAF=80041499}} {{Persondata | NAME =Young, Zora | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION =[[United States|American]] [[blues]] singer | DATE OF BIRTH =January 21, 1948 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[West Point, Mississippi|West Point]], [[Mississippi]], United States | Official Website =[http://www.ZoraYoungMusic.com www.ZoraYoungMusic.com] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Young, Zora}} [[Category:1948 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:American blues singers]] [[Category:Gospel blues musicians]] [[Category:Musicians from Mississippi]] [[Category:American female singers]] [[Category:Soul-blues musicians]]
